intro: Lepidagathis mindorensis, commonly known as the Mindanao lepidagathis, is a flowering plant species native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments in the undergrowth of tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
